post.body: @LifeSansBldgs We need all the power we can get! Speaking of which, pity drinks soon? (Sorry I missed last night.)
What about coffee and chocolate cleanse?
Sweet! Now get to work!
End of an era: Sparks has been discontinued.
Up to my eyelids.
The "what they called an occupation" in the NYT: http://tinyurl.com/4w2o9o "People just don’t give equality away, you have to take it.”
Shit's getting riled at the New School. http://www.newschoolinexile.com/
Sweet irony -- my name is finally on the Curbed masthead.
"It's where dreams go to take a nap."
This book just keeps on fucking growing. It was so cute at first! What happened?
"In Debt We Trust" is hokey but should be required viewing. Except, oh yeah, it's all coming true already! Oh well!
I only read Gawker for the cop indictment Christmas miracles. http://tinyurl.com/5by824
Uh oh, it's morning time again. Uh oh, wait, no it's not.
Demystifying.
Pretty excited for Streetsblog SF.
The tendinitis has metastasized to the elbow.
Oh yay, I'm on @themediaisdying.
This makes me feel much better about going back. http://sbinfoshop.org/
Sometimes all you can do is cross your fingers and make some pancakes.
Yay.
"God bless Greenspan, patron saint of pool skatin’." http://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/29/us/29pools.html
One foot after the other.
Belated Christmas present: miracle berry tablets! Assembling a tasting menu now.
(We aren't paid to fact check.)
"Soon enough, we’re going to start getting what we pay for, and we may find out just how little that is." http://tinyurl.com/62jv23
At this rate of exodus I don't know how any of you manage to be employed in Portland, I really don't.
"You can't beat the axis if you get VD!" http://tinyurl.com/syphilady
Wow, minimum wage in SF will go up to $9.79 next year. That'll be about how much a Muni ride will cost then, too, right?
Finally starting pencils. X-mess miracle.
Cautiously optimistic.
It appears I have lost. We are getting a tree after all.
I hope legal-sized kraft cardstock exists. The internet is currently pointing to no.
The irony of ReadyMade's Wish Lists is overwhelming. "Sure, it's conspicuous consumption, but it's ECO-FRIENDLY!" "Oh, WELL then!"
Not snowing in LA, but I can't remember the last time it was this cold here. Everyone's got parkas over their velour tracksuits.
A little cat vomit to send me off.
Adventures in Babysitting!!1!
Damn that is a lot of package for such a tiny Wacom.
